ENGINEERING PROJECT MANAGER

EXPERIENCE

Engineering Project Manager ,

05/2015 to 07/2017
Company Name
— City , State
Managed various engineering projects from start to finish while cultivating the client relationship and overall sales processes both internally and externally.
Tracked and reported key performance indicators while keeping present with market trends.
Created data automation processes for managing projects.
Processed proposals for new and existing customers with intentional sales tactics.
Increased department sales revenue by 65%; achieved financial objectives by preparing annual department budgets and scheduling expenditures via Microsoft AX/AX7.
Sr. Project Manager ,

07/2017 to 03/2017
Company Name
— City , State
Managed high volume projects from training to installation of door hardware locks and automation locking systems for various hotel chains; 60 projects on average with use of agile methology discipline and use of Microsoft AX 365.
Handled rotating schedules while delivering projects on time and on budget for the department.
Developed processes that help streamline project milestones; created action plans based on client needs.
Communicated real time project status and changes to clients/upper leadership as needed in accordance with project guidelines and clarity reporting open workbench software.
Leader of special projects from Marriott, Hyatt and Hilton that require more detailed focus; Investigated, analyzes and recommended solutions for client implementation issues.
Sr. Traffic Coordinator Ad Manager ,

02/2010 to 05/2015
Company Name
— City , State
Responsible for scheduling and ensuring commercial advertisements air on cable networks per client's contract.
Worked with clients and agencies to ensure ad copy and instructions are received and correct copy is ran; Inputs the titles of client advertisements into database and enters the instructions for ad airing.
Maximized billing opportunities by evaluating sold and scheduled inventory and adjusting commercial placement as needed.
Developed technical and systematic procedures to assist in the servicing of clients in addition to identifying problems and recommended solutions as needed.
Reviewed various documents for accuracy, and works with sales to resolve issues with changes or missing information against the initial advertising contract per client; Average client load 25.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Engineering Project Manager / Project Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Description ﻿Responsibilities: Specific Duties, Activities and Responsibilities include but are not limited to: 1. Responsible for project management execution and management of a team that delivers the initiation, design, construction, commissioning and operational start-up of business initiatives / goals, programs, manufacturing equipment, facilities, laboratories and office buildings. 2. Ensures that project delivery methodologies, project management processes/principles and project management tools are utilized to achieve project goals. Owns the key project management business processes and improves and simplifies these processes continuously. 3. Partners proactively and aligns with key internal customers to develop and execute capital projects that support business objectives. 4. Partners proactively with other group/function managers with strategic partners (Finance, Procurement, etc.) to support business objectives, streamline business processes impacting project planning/execution, and implement business process changes. 5. Delivers successful projects, effectively balancing quality, scope, cost and schedule. 6. Provides guidance, direction and advice to area PM’s (contract and site) with respect to actions or decisions related to changes in project scope, schedule and cost. 7. Manages the project controls function in support of active capital projects. 8. Analyzes and reviews the capital forecast and other planning tools to assess resource requirements and help determine staffing requirements. 9. Provides feedback and guidance to project staff. 10. Support Manufacturing and/or Facilities personnel in trouble-shooting problems in the operation of pharmaceutical and industrial manufacturing facility systems and equipment. 11. Per the above, strategizes on what modifications or investments might be required to accommodate the new client business onto our network assets. 12. Follows corporate standards and best practices. Education or Equivalent: BS/MS in Engineering discipline with experience in PM role for CGT/Bio projects. Experience: • Bachelor's degree in Chemical/Mechanical Engineering; Advanced Degree in technical / business area a plus. • Clear technical experience in design and operation of CGT technologies. • 5-10 years of engineering related experience • 5 years in BioPharm/CGT Industry experience • Previous role accountable for Project Management of $10M+ of value

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
